abstract: Ford’s sales fell 12 percent in 2007, allowing Toyota to replace it as the country’s second largest seller of vehicles. It was the first year that Ford was not No. 2, behind General Motors, since 1931.
snippet: Ford’s sales fell 12 percent in 2007, allowing Toyota to replace it as the country’s second largest seller of vehicles. It was the first year that Ford was not No. 2, behind General Motors, since 1931.
lead_paragraph: DETROIT  The Ford Motor Company’s United States sales fell 12 percent in 2007, allowing Toyota Motor of Japan to replace it as the country’s second largest seller of vehicles.

headline.main: Toyota Ousts Ford From No. 2 Spot in U.S. Sales
